gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class ControlList

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ControlList
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ControlList
extends ViewControl

This class is a ViewControl that allows the user to enter a list of values. This ViewControl is useful when the user can enter any number of parameters. Filters can also be applied to this ViewControl using the enableFilter(StringFilter) method. This can be used to allow the user to enter only specific types of data to the list (i.e. only integers, floats, or Strings).

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

LIST_VALUES_KEY

public static final java.lang.String LIST_VALUES_KEY
"Listed Values" - This static constant String is a key for referencing the state information for the values displayed in the list on this ViewControl. The value that this key references is an Object[].

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENTRY_FIELD_KEY

public static final java.lang.String ENTRY_FIELD_KEY
"Entry Field Key" - This static constant String is a key for referencing the state information for the FieldEntryControl object on this ViewControl. This FieldEntryControl object contains one label and one text field. This text field is the field that allows the user to enter the values to add to this ViewControl's list. The value that this key references is an ObjectState (of a FieldEntryControl object).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constructor Detail

ControlList

public ControlList(java.lang.String title,
                   StringFilter filter)
Construct a ControlList with the given title such that the user can only enter values in the list if the given filter decides they are ok.

Parameters:
title - The title of this ViewControl.
filter - The filter used to limit the type of data that can be added to the list (i.e. only integers, float, or Strings).

ControlList

public ControlList(StringFilter filter)
Construct a ControlList with "" as its title and a filter set such that the user can only enter values in the list if the given filter decides they are ok.

Parameters:
filter - The filter used to limit the type of data that can be added to the list (i.e. only integers, float, or Strings).

ControlList

public ControlList(java.lang.String title)
Construct a ControlList with the given title. No filters are applied. Thus the user can add anything he/she wants to the list.

Parameters:
title - The title of this ViewControl.

ControlList

public ControlList()
Construct a ControlList with "" as its title. Also no filters are applied. Thus the user can add anything he/she wants to the list.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state variables stored for this ControlList wrapped in an ObjectState object.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
getObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
isDefault -
  • If true, the ObjectState returned will contain the state variables corresponding to the typical default configuration for this ControlList.
  • If false, the ObjectState containing the state variables corresponding to the current configuration for this ControlList will be returned.
Returns:
An ObjectState object that contains the state variables that save the state of this ControlList.

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to modify the way this ControlList is displayed. For example, the ObjectState for this object contains keys that allow you to modify the text that appears on the buttons displayed on this ControlList.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
setObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
state - The ObjectState containing the state variables that describe the new way this ControlList will be displayed.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Used to determine if this control's list of values is empty.

Returns:
True if the list is empty and false if it isn't.

sort

public void sort(java.util.Comparator comp)
Sorts the items displayed in the list. This method uses the java.util.Arrays.sort(Object[], Comparator) method which gaurantees n*log(n) performance.

Also, as stated in the description of the java.util.Arrays.sort(Object[], Comparator) method, comp.compare(ob1, ob2) must not throw a ClassCastException for any Objects in the list for this method to work.

Parameters:
comp - This is the object that is used to compare any two objects in the list. The comparator to use depends on the objects that were added to the list. For example, if Strings were added to the list, use a Comparator that compares Strings (i.e. check if one String is "greater than" another String).

enableFilter

public void enableFilter(StringFilter filter)
Used to specify which filter is used to limit the type of data the user can add to the list.

Parameters:
filter - The filter used to limit the type of data that can be added to the list (i.e. only integers, float, or Strings). Note: If filter==null, this method disables filtering.
See Also:
disableFilter()

disableFilter

public void disableFilter()
Used to disable filtering. If filtering is disabled, the user can enter any type of data to the list.

See Also:
enableFilter(StringFilter)

setEntryBoxLabel

public void setEntryBoxLabel(java.lang.String label)
Used to set the label that prompts the user to enter data to add to the list.

Parameters:
label - The new label. Note: If label==null nothing is done.

getEntryBoxLabel

public java.lang.String getEntryBoxLabel()
Used to get the label that prompts the user to enter data to add to the list.

Returns:
The label that tells the user to enter data to the list.

setEntryBoxValue

public void setEntryBoxValue(java.lang.String value)
Used to set the data that appears in the text field that the user uses to enter data to the list. Note: If a filter has been applied to limit the possible input, the value will only be set if it passes through the filter.

Parameters:
value - The data to enter in the text field used to enter data in the list.

getEntryBoxValue

public java.lang.String getEntryBoxValue()
This ViewControl contains a text field that the user uses to enter data. Then, he/she can choose to enter this data in the list. This method returns the data currently entered in this text field.

Returns:
The data that is about to be entered in the list.
